attributes.action: Award all members of the 1966 World Cup winning side with a Knighthood.
attributes.additional_details:
Given the recent passing of Gordon Banks, widely recognised as England's greatest ever goalscorer, I decided to start this petition to bring about a Knighthood for each member of the 1966 World Cup winning team. Sadly, posthumously in some cases.

A goal scorer will not score goals without supply from their teammates and the team will not will matches if the concede more goals than they score. 

The World Cup was not won by two players.
attributes.background:
Football is a team game and every component part of the World Cup winning team played a role in taking home the Jules Rimet trophy. 
It is grossly unfair, therefore, that the only members of that team awarded a Knighthood are Geoff Hurst and Bobby Charlton.
This should be rectified immediately.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because it asks for someone to be nominated for an honour. 

Members of the public can nominate people for honours directly. You can find out how to nominate someone for an honour here:

https://www.gov.uk/honours
